metadata.title: CVE-2021-47495 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: usbnet:sanity check for maxpacket maxpacket of 0 makes no sense and oopses as weneed to divide by it. Give up. V2: fixed typo in log and stylistic issues

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-lowlatency - 4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-aws - 4.15.0-1119.126~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1130-azure - 4.15.0-1130.143~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-gcp - 4.15.0-1115.129~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1086-oracle - 4.15.0-1086.94~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1119.126~16.04.2').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1130.143~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.129~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1086.94~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
